com.gej.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.map.Map

  • public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a map (tile-based of course!) which is currently playing the game. You could use the MapManager class to control the order of maps. Note that this class is completely static. A map requires MapInfo objects if you does't want to load from file ( so nobody can edit your levels )
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

      • getTileAt

        public static char getTileAt(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the character in the map file at the specified tile position of the object. ( Note that it is only used for debugging ).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the tile
        y - The y-position of the tile
        Returns:
        The character represented by the tile

      • isObjectCollisionFree

        public static boolean isObjectCollisionFree(float x,
                            float y,
                            boolean solid,
                            GObject object)
        Checks if a specific position is collision free in the map.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the object
        y - The y-position of the object
        solid - Whether to check only for solid object
        object - The object ( used for width and height )
        Returns:
        True if no-collision and false if it collides.

      • isObjectCollisionFree

        public static boolean isObjectCollisionFree(float x,
                            float y,
                            GObject object)
        Checks if a specific position is collision free in the map.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the object
        y - The y-position of the object
        object - The object ( uses image for pixel-perfect collision detection )
        Returns:
        True if no-collision and false if it collides.

      • getObjects

        Returns a list of objects in the current map.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList containing all the objects

      • renderMap

        public static void renderMap(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
             int x,
             int y)
        Renders the map at a specific position. visibleRect is the rectangle passed so that only the visible objects are drawn.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context
        x - The x-position
        y - The y-position

        Updates all the objects contained in the map.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - The time elapsed in the current frame.

      • removeObjectsOfType

        public static void removeObjectsOfType(java.lang.Class<?> c)
        Removes all objects of a class from this map. Useful to destroy all bombs etc., Example: 
         Map.removeObjectsOfType(Bomb.class);
        Parameters:
        c - The class of the object

      • isAlignedToGrid

        public static boolean isAlignedToGrid(GObject obj)
        Checks if an object is aligned to the grid
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the object is positioned exactly at the left corner of the grid

      • isAlignedToGrid

        public static boolean isAlignedToGrid(float x,
                      float y)
        Checks if a position is aligned to the grid
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position
        y - The y-position
        Returns:
        True if the point is left corner of any cell in the grid.
